title: Crypto Library
author: Crypto Library
content: Is there any handy tools to see individually how many legendary or hero or senior and all other members are in forum ? I went to bpip and loyce club but couldn't find the things. If anyone knows about it please let me know the process about it.Thank in advance .

comments.author: dzungmobile
comments.body: Quote from: Crypto Library on April 01, 2023, 10:57:15 PMIs there any handy tools to see individually how many legendary or hero or senior and all other members are in forum ? DdmrDdmr's Merit Dashboard has it in a table for Forum ranks.https://public.tableau.com/app/profile/ddmrddmr/viz/BitcointalkMeritDashboard/PersonalSummary

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: It's hard to get accurate Rank data on all users. The Rank can change at any moment (when posts are made or deleted), and you'll have to check each profile to be sure. At 3.5 million profiles and 1 check per second, that takes 6 weeks. And by the time you're done, many user ranks have changed already.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: coinerer on April 02, 2023, 11:25:25 PMBut AI bots can be the solution to this problem.Using buzzwords doesn't help anyone.If I'd want to know all Ranks, I'd start by counting how many posts each user made. That should eliminate the users who never posted, or didn't post enough to reach Jr. Member. For the remaining users you can download the profile to get the Rank, and you can keep an eye on who makes new posts to see who upgrades to the next Rank. It's not flawless, but it's close.
